Class LevelManager

java.lang.Object
ija.ijaProject.game.levels.LevelManager
public class LevelManager extends Object
LevelManager handles tracking and persistence of level completion status. It uses the Singleton pattern to ensure a single instance throughout the application.

    • LevelManager

      private LevelManager()
      Private constructor to enforce singleton pattern. Loads saved progress when created.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static LevelManager getInstance()
      Gets the singleton instance of LevelManager.
      Returns:
      The LevelManager instance

    • markLevelCompleted

      public void markLevelCompleted(int levelNumber, int difficulty)
      Marks a level as completed.
      Parameters:
      levelNumber - The level number
      difficulty - The difficulty level (0=Beginner, 1=Intermediate, 2=Advanced)

    • isLevelCompleted

      public boolean isLevelCompleted(int levelNumber, int difficulty)
      Checks if a level is completed.
      Parameters:
      levelNumber - The level number
      difficulty - The difficulty level
      Returns:
      true if the level is completed, false otherwise

    • getHighestCompletedLevel

      public int getHighestCompletedLevel(int difficulty)
      Gets the highest completed level for a difficulty.
      Parameters:
      difficulty - The difficulty level
      Returns:
      The highest completed level number, or 0 if none completed

    • saveProgress

      private void saveProgress()
      Saves progress to file.

      private void loadProgress()
      Loads progress from file.

    • resetProgress

      public void resetProgress()
      Resets all progress.

    • resetLevelCompletion

      public void resetLevelCompletion(int levelNumber, int difficulty)
      Resets the completion status for a specific level and difficulty.
      Parameters:
      levelNumber - The level number
      difficulty - The difficulty level

    • getCompletedLevels

      public Set<String> getCompletedLevels()
      Gets all completed levels.
      Returns:
      A set of level keys in the format "difficulty-levelNumber"
